required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Comfilcon A Toric Contact Lenses and Samfilcon A Toric Contact Lenses
clinical_study.official_title: A Bilateral Dispensing Comparison of Biofinity Toric and Ultra for Astigmatism

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate the subjective acceptance of comfilcon A toric contact lens, compared to samfilcon A toric lens.

primary_outcome.description: Subjective ratings of comfort for each pair of lenses (scale: 0-10; 0=painful,10=can't feel lens)
Subjective ratings of comfort for each pair of lenses (scale: 0-10; 0=painful,10=can't feel lens)
Subjective ratings of comfort for each pair of lenses (scale: 0-10; 0=painful,10=can't feel lens)

primary_outcome.measure: Lens Preference Based on Overall Comfort
primary_outcome.description: Lens preference with respect to comfort (Prefer pair-1 strongly, Prefer pair-1 slightly, Prefer pair-2 strongly, prefer pair-2 slightly, No preference)

primary_outcome.measure: Lens Preference Based on Overall Dryness
primary_outcome.description: Lens preference with respect to dryness (Prefer pair-1 strongly, Prefer pair-1 slightly, Prefer pair-2 strongly, prefer pair-2 slightly, No preference)
Subjective ratings of dryness for each pair of lenses (scale: 0-10; 0=Extremely dry, 10=No dryness)
Subjective ratings of dryness for each pair of lenses (scale: 0-10; 0=Extremely dry, 10=No dryness)

secondary_outcome.description: Subjective rating of ease of inserting the lens onto the eye (scale 0-10; 0=very difficult, 10=very easy)
Subjective rating of ease of inserting the lens onto the eye (scale 0-10; 0=very difficult, 10=very easy)
Subjective rating of ease of inserting the lens onto the eye (scale 0-10; 0=very difficult, 10=very easy)
Subjective rating of ease of removing the lens from the eye (scale 0-10; 0=very difficult, 10=very easy)
Subjective rating of ease of removing the lens from the eye (scale 0-10; 0=very difficult, 10=very easy)

arm_group.description: Subjects who wear comfilcon A toric lens either as first or second pair during this cross-over study.
Subjects who wear samfilcon A toric lens either as first or second pair during this cross-over study.

overall_official.affiliation: Director, Centre for Ocular Research & Education

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Subjects were randomized to wear comfilcon A toric lenses for 1-month and samfilcon A toric lenses for 1-month in this cross-over dispensing study.

group.title: Comfilcon A Toric Then Samfilcon A Toric
group.description: Subjects were randomized to wear comfilcon A toric lenses for 1-month and then crossover to wear Samfilcon A toric lenses for 1-month. Contact Lens: comfilcon A toric Contact Lens: Samfilcon A toric

group.title: Samfilcon A Toric Then Comfilcon A Toric
group.description: Subjects were randomized to wear sammfilcon A toric lenses for 1-month and then crossover to wear comfilcon A toric lenses for 1-month. Contact Lens: Samfilcon A toric Contact Lens: comfilcon A toric

participants_list.participants: One subject had non-significant adverse event and data not included in the analysis
3 subjects had non-significant adverse events and data not included in analysis.
Subjects who wore samfilcon A toric at 1st intervention wear comfilcon A toric at 2nd intervention
Subjects who wore comfilcon A toric at 1st intervention wear Samfilcon A toric at 2nd intervention

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.description: Subjective ratings of comfort for each pair of lenses (scale: 0-10; 0=painful,10=can't feel lens)

outcome.description: Subjective ratings of comfort for each pair of lenses (scale: 0-10; 0=painful,10=can't feel lens)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
